block.p: Amy Landsborough Karlen, a daughter of Sven and Laura Karlen of Woodstock, Conn., was married on Friday to Scott Joseph Neuman, the son of John and Carolyn Neuman of Rye, N.Y. The Rev. Michael O'Connor performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection in Rye.

The bride, 23, teaches the fourth grade at the Town School for Boys in San Francisco. She and her husband graduated from Cornell University. Her father is the general partner of Grandview Partners, an investment firm in Boston.

Amy Landsborough Karlen, a daughter of Sven and Laura Karlen of Woodstock, Conn., was married on Friday to Scott Joseph Neuman, the son of John and Carolyn Neuman of Rye, N.Y. The Rev. Michael O'Connor performed the Roman Catholic ceremony at the Church of the Resurrection in Rye.

The bride, 23, teaches the fourth grade at the Town School for Boys in San Francisco. She and her husband graduated from Cornell University. Her father is the general partner of Grandview Partners, an investment firm in Boston.

The bridegroom, 24, is a media planner in San Francisco at J. Walter Thompson, the advertising agency. His mother is the associate director of the Samaritan Counseling Center in Rye and teaches family-systems theory at the Center for Family Learning, an educational center for training, research and therapy, in Rye Brook, N.Y. His father is a vice president of Meritus Consulting Services, management consultants in New York. WEDDINGS
